intro: Ophiorrhiza ensiformis, commonly known as the lanceleaf banyan, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often clustered at the base of the plant. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Ophiorrhiza ensiformis is often found in the understory of rainforests in Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands.
